embeds.title: Staff holds the final word in enforcing rules and punishments. Appeals are possible, but hostility towards a decision may result in further punishment.

fields.name: 2.1: Enforcement
fields.value: Staff will try to not enforce rules too strictly: Context should always matter. Conversely, certain offenses are subject to faster, harsher punishment than normal.

fields.name: 2.2: Rule Breaking
fields.value: In general, Staff will follow this process for rule-breaking: Call out the broken rule, ideally in private chat, and issue a punishment related to the offense.As well, all offenses will be documented, along with screenshots of the behavior.

fields.name: 2.3: __Offenses and Punishments__
fields.value: Below is our 5 strike system

fields.name: 2.3a: 1st Offense
fields.value: Request to stop

fields.name: 2.3b: 2nd Offense
fields.value: Formal Warning

fields.name: 2.3c: 3rd Offense
fields.value: Kick, roles stripped for 24 hours

fields.name: 2.3d: 4th Offense
fields.value: Up to decision of staff, either a ban or kick with 72 hours role strip

fields.name: 2.3e: 5th Offense
fields.value: Ban

embeds.title: Staff holds the final word in enforcing rules and punishments. Appeals are possible, but hostility towards a decision may result in further punishment.

fields.name: 2.1: Enforcement
fields.value: Staff will try to not enforce rules too strictly. Context should always matter. Conversely, certain offenses are subject to faster, harsher punishment than normal.

fields.name: 2.2: Rule Breaking
fields.value: In general, Staff will follow this process for rule-breaking: Call out the broken rule, ideally in private chat, and issue a punishment related to the offense. As well, all offenses will be documented, along with screenshots of the behavior.

fields.name: 2.3: __Offenses and Punishments__
fields.value:
Below is our 5 strike system 
 __2.3a: 1st Offense__ 
 Request to stop. 
 __2.3b: 2nd Offense__ 
Formal Warning. 
 __2.3c: 3rd Offense__
 Kick, roles stripped for 24 hours. 
 __2.3d: 4th Offense__
 Up to decision of staff, either a ban or kick with 72 hours role strip. 
 __2.3e: 5th Offense__ 
 Ban, depending on the severity may include an appeal.

fields.name: 2.4: Custom Status Enforcement
fields.value: We the staff team will try to understand the intent of the status at issue. When approached by staff we ask that you simply communicate with us as to what your status means. Some statuses can be understood and left as they are, while others we will require a user to change them.

fields.name: 2.5: Custom Status Rule Breaking
fields.value:
Staff will, in most cases, follow these guidelines for statuses that break the rules. A private discussion concerning the intent of the status, and issuing a punishment for the offense if one is necessary. Offenses will be documented by staff, as well as pictures relating to the event. 
 If these rules are repeatedly broken by an individual, the punishment will increase in severity.

fields.name: 2.6: Offenses and Punishment
fields.value:
__1st Incident__ 
 Private discussion with the member. 
 __2.6b 2nd Incident__ 
 If anything is amiss, the member will be asked to change their status within a day. 
 __2.6c 3rd Incident__ 
 If the status has not been changed/removed staff will issue a role strip.
If the user changes their status, they will receive their roles back. 
 __2.7 Offensive Statuses__ 
  Any status that is outwardly derogatory or offensive may result in a ban depending on the circumstance.

fields.name: 3.1: #announcements
fields.value: News, server updates; go here: <#312678652682960897>

fields.name: 3.2: #promotions
fields.value: Links to free games and products being given with the Freebie role, plus the occasional ad; go here: <#521159562288431104>

fields.name: 3.3: #general
fields.value: Anything goes - English only!; go here: <#214581602557100032>

fields.name: 3.4: #gaymes
fields.value: Look for people to play with, news, updates, etc; go here: <#359175111129038849>

fields.name: 3.5: #literature
fields.value: Discussions and suggestions for books; go here: <#455055424236814341>

fields.name: 3.6: #music
fields.value: Share songs, hold listening parties, talk news and new tracks; go here: <#322124997202018314>

fields.name: 3.7: #sports
fields.value: For people who are interested in sports, want to rave about their favorite teams, or for those who just want to talk about athleticism; go here: <#592364310932619264>

fields.name: 3.8: #tech
fields.value: Advice, support, news, and any cool pictures of setups or new purchases; go here: <#359174922679091201>

fields.name: 3.9: #tv_movies
fields.value: Advice on stuff to watch, hyping over new releases, trailers, theorycrafting. **Spoilers allowed**; go here: <#419335590257885184>

fields.name: 3.10: #aww
fields.value: Cute animals, photos, etc; go here: <#320338798091436032>

fields.name: 3.11: #creative
fields.value: Anything artsy goes here; Always give the source where you can!; go here: <#320340980542865408>

fields.name: 3.12: #events
fields.value: Gather viewing parties using the role; also used for the occasional server event Staff may hold; go here: <#379075912609562624>

fields.name: 3.13: #food
fields.value: Photos and recipes; go here: <#376985306290847747>

fields.name: 3.14: #memes
fields.value: Self-explanatory, but all of our rules apply. Things that give you a chuckle, and follow the rules go here in: <#228376550578323459>

fields.name: 3.15: #smile
fields.value: Wholesome videos, memes, pictures, or anything else that could motivate or warm the heart you'll find here: <#455032678757171211>

fields.name: 3.16: #trashbin
fields.value: Catch-all for anything that might not belong anywhere else; go here: <#217151180340592641>

fields.name: 3.17: #serious
fields.value: Seek out support, advice, or any kind of input on something that might be bothering you; go here: <#320327740081307650>

fields.name: 3.18: #venting
fields.value: Same as above, but with no responses from others allowed; to get something off your chest head here: <#507214873839796224>

fields.name: 3.19: #victories
fields.value: Overcame an obstacle, solved a difficult problem in life, or a heartwarming story to share? Tell us all about it here: <#640267878649692161>

fields.name: 3.19: #voice
fields.value: No mic? No problem! Talk to people in a voice channel through here; go here: <#320333246015733763>

fields.name: 3.20: #bot_commands
fields.value: If you have a need for our server's bot, you can take care of it here - commands are pinned in the channel; go here: <#437322983569096706>
